meanings.definition: The quality or state of being suitable for human habitation.
meanings.sent1: The habitabilities of the new apartment made it a comfortable place to live.
meanings.sent2: The habitabilities of the desert are limited due to the extreme heat and lack of water.
meanings.sent3: The habitabilities of the treehouse were so cozy that even the squirrels wanted to move in.
meanings.sent4: The habitabilities of the underground bunker were a stark contrast to the open fields above.
meanings.sent5: The habitabilities of the spaceship were carefully designed to mimic Earth's environment.

meanings.definition: The ability of a place to support life or living organisms.
meanings.sent1: Exploring Mars to study its habitabilities is a fascinating scientific endeavor.
meanings.sent2: The habitabilities of the coral reef attract a diverse range of marine species.
meanings.sent3: The habitabilities of the backyard garden were so inviting that even the butterflies couldn't resist.
meanings.sent4: The habitabilities of the rainforest create a lush and vibrant ecosystem teeming with biodiversity.
meanings.sent5: The habitabilities of the deep sea are still largely unexplored by humans.
